content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
No new structures have been successfully created on the map during these steps. Although attempts were made to supply or craft a Lab at Position(x=0.5, y=2.5), none succeeded due to inventory and resource issues. Pre‐existing smelting facilities (for example, the furnace at Position(x=5.0, y=5.0) and the copper furnace at Position(x=-27.0, y=-60.0)) were referenced for processing raw materials, but no additional structure was placed.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• API Parameter Misuse – Incorrectly calling get_entities. In some attempts a keyword argument “radius” was passed even though the function did not expect it, and later positional parameters were used when none are expected. Always verify the API’s signature and use proper arguments.
  
• Iteration on None – When filtering retrieved entities (e.g. labs) the code attempted to iterate over a NoneType. Ensure that the return value is validated (or defaulted to an empty list) before iterating.
  
• Placement without Inventory – Repeated attempts to place a Lab at Position(x=0.5, y=2.5) failed because no Lab was available in inventory. Confirm that the required item exists in inventory before attempting placement.
  
• Lab Crafting Resource Shortages – Multiple crafting errors for the Lab occurred due to missing sub-ingredients (such as iron-gear-wheels, electronic-circuits, and copper-cables). Verify that all sub-components are available or can be produced (through proper smelting or assembling processes) before initiating a Lab craft.
  
• Cross-Checking Resource Quantities – Crafting failures indicating insufficient ingredients (for example, missing iron-gear-wheels or copper-plate for copper-cable production) highlight the need to compare available resources against recipe requirements before starting production.
